item.title: Definition of a Perfect Code in Coding Theory
item.description: An (n,M,d)_{q}-code over the alphabet A is perfect if the following holds: M=\frac{q^{n}}{\text{vol}(S_{\epsilon(d)}(c))}:\epsilon(d)=\left\lfloor\frac{d-1}{2}\right\rfloor,\text{for ...
